decision_conditions: The proposed development is located within a Critical Drainage Area and insufficient&nbsp;information has been provided on SUSs compliance,&nbsp;or&nbsp;measures to be used or management of surface water and drainage, it has not been demonstrated that the proposed development would not exacerbate the risk of flooding within the site or increase the risk and consequences of flooding elsewhere,&nbsp;contrary to the high-quality design aspirations set out in the ‘National Planning Policy Framework’&nbsp;(2023),&nbsp;Policies SI12 and SI13 of the ‘London Plan’&nbsp;(2021), Policies DM9, DM10, DM12 of&nbsp;&nbsp;the ‘Harrow Development Management Policies Plan’&nbsp;(2013) and Core Policy CS1.U of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012).

The existing/proposed outbuilding, by
reason of its location/siting, poor design (bulk, scale, height and material
use) in context of neighbouring outbuildings/buildings and local character,
results in an unsympathetic and visually obtrusive form of development which is
detrimental to the character and appearance of the host property, the wider area
and a Protected View Setting Corridor.&nbsp;
The proposal falls contrary to the high-quality design aspirations set
out in the ‘National Planning Policy Framework’ (2023), Policy
D3.D(1)(11) of the ‘London Plan’ (2021), Policies DM1(A)((B)(a)(b)(c)(d)
of&nbsp; the ‘Harrow Development Management
Policies Plan’ (2013), Policy CS1(B) of the ‘Harrow Core Strategy’
(2012), and guidance contained within the Councils adopted a Supplementary
Planning Document entitled&nbsp; ‘Residential
Design Guide’ (2010).
